info.title: Reply API
info.description: API for managing email sequences, contacts, and automation workflows

get.description: Returns a list of all sequences in your account
Returns sequence details by Id
Returns a list of all steps in a sequence

200.description: List of sequence steps retrieved successfully

post.description: Creates one or more new steps in a sequence

get.description: Returns details of a specific sequence step

post.description: Enables a variant of a sequence step

stepId.description: Unique identifier for the sequence step

emailVariants.description: List of email variants associated with the step

variantId.description: Unique identifier for the email variant

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the variant is enabled or disabled

post.description: Disables a variant of a sequence step

stepId.description: Unique identifier for the sequence step

emailVariants.description: List of email variants associated with the step

variantId.description: Unique identifier for the email variant

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the variant is enabled or disabled

get.description: Retrieve all contacts enrolled in the sequence

post.description: Add an existing or new contact to the sequence.

requestBody.description: Either provide an existing contactId to add to the sequence, or provide a contact object. If a contact object is provided and the contact doesn't exist in the system, a new contact will be created before being added to the sequence.

contact.description: Contact object. If provided instead of contactId and contact doesn't exist, it will be created

forcePush.description: If true, the contact will be moved from their current sequence to this sequence. If false, the contact will remain in their current sequence and won't be added to this sequence.

startStep.description: Optional step ID to start from

delete.description: Remove a contact from the sequence or optionally from all sequences

removeFromAll.description: If true, removes the contact from all sequences instead of just the specified sequence

post.description: Add multiple contacts to the sequence at once

forcePush.description: If true, contacts will be moved from their current sequences to this one. If false, contacts will remain in their current sequences and won't be added to this one.

startStep.description: Optional step ID to start from

invalidEmailSkips.description: Contact IDs that were skipped due to invalid email addresses

ownershipSkips.description: Contact IDs that were skipped due to ownership restrictions

optOutSkips.description: Contact IDs that were skipped due to opt-out status

delete.description: Remove multiple contacts from the sequence at once

get.description: Returns a paginated list of all contacts in your account
Returns contact details by ID

patch.description: Updates an existing contact including status changes

get.description: Returns contacts matching the email search criteria

get.summary: Get list of contacts with changed stage
get.description: Retrieve a list of contacts whose stages have changed

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. If not provided, all fields will be returned. For better performance, we recommend specifying only the fields you need.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Retrieve stage changes since a specific timestamp

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page

parameters.name: fromStage
parameters.description:
Filter contacts that transitioned from a specific stage. Available stages:

1 = New
2 = Engaging
3 = Replied
4 = Interested
5 = Not interested
6 = Unresponsive
7 = Do not contact
8 = Bad contact info

parameters.name: toStage
parameters.description:
Filter contacts that transitioned to a specific stage. Available stages:

1 = New
2 = Engaging
3 = Replied
4 = Interested
5 = Not interested
6 = Unresponsive
7 = Do not contact
8 = Bad contact info

get.description: Returns all contact lists
Returns list details by Id
Returns a list of all email templates
Returns template details by Id

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Flter blacklist items by type (domain or email)

get.description: Returns a list of all email accounts

id.description: Unique identifier for the email account

post.description: Creates a new email account. Only works with custom email account providers (SMTP/IMAP).

get.description: Returns email account details by Id. Only works with custom email account providers (SMTP/IMAP).

patch.description: Updates an existing email account. Only works with custom email account providers (SMTP/IMAP).

get.description: Returns a list of all webhook subscriptions
Generates a report about email activities
Downloads a generated report by Id
Returns a list of all branded links
Returns branded link details by Id

BlackListItems.title: BlackListItems
BlackListItems.description: Represents blacklist entries for domains and email addresses

id.description: Unique identifier for the SMTP email account

email.description: The email address used for sending emails

dailyLimit.description: The maximum number of emails you can send per day

senderName.description: The name that will be displayed as the sender in email recipients' inboxes

smtpHost.description: The hostname or IP address of the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server used for sending emails

smtpPort.description: The port number used for communication with the SMTP server (typically 465 for SMTP with SSL/TLS encryption)

smtpPassword.description: The password for the email address used for sending emails

smtpSsl.description: This option controls whether SSL is used for the SMTP connection

imapHost.description: The hostname or IP address of the Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) server used for receiving emails

imapPort.description: The port number used for communication with the IMAP server (typically 993 for IMAP with SSL/TLS encryption)

imapPassword.description: The password for the email address used for receiving emails

imapSsl.description: This option controls whether SSL is used for the IMAP connection

isArchived.description: Indicates if the sequence is archived

numberOfSkills.description: The amount of skills you would like to endorse

EndorseSkills.description: Endorse a specified number of skills on the profile

audioFile.description: The audio file containing the voice message

VoiceMessage.description: Send a voice message to the profile

id.description: Unique identifier for the template step

type.description: Defines whether the step requires manual intervention or runs automatically. Automatic steps are executed by the system, while Manual steps require user action.

subType.description: The type of LinkedIn action to perform

data.description:
Specifies the details for the LinkedIn action. 

- **Message**: Send a direct message to a connected contact
- **Connect**: Send a connection request
- **InMail**: Send an InMail to a non-connected contact
- **ViewProfile**: View the contact's LinkedIn profile
- **LikeRecentPost**: Like the contact's most recent post
- **EndorseSkills**: Endorse contact's skills
- **FollowProfile**: Follow the contact's profile
- **VoiceMessage**: Send a voice message to a connected contact 

 **Note:** LikeRecentPost and LikeProfile actions do not require additional parameters.

Details.content: Hi {{contact.firstName}}, I noticed your great work at {{contact.company}}.

data.message: I'd like to join your professional network.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SMS step

type.description: Defines whether the step requires manual intervention or runs automatically. Automatic steps are executed by the system, while Manual steps require user action.

example.text: Hi {{contact.firstName}}, this is {{user.firstName}} from {{user.company}}. Would love to connect!

id.description: Unique identifier for the call step

note.description: Notes or script for the call

example.note: Discuss product features and gather feedback about their current challenges.

example.message: Hi {{contact.firstName}}, I wanted to reach out regarding our services. Would you be interested in learning more?

id.description: Unique identifier for the template step

action.description: Move to the next step immediately or Wait for Action from Zapier to move to the next step

id.description: Unique identifier for the task step

description.description: Description of the task to be completed

example.description: Follow up with the prospect about the proposal

number.description: Sequential number for the step. Must be a sequence starting from 1

inMinutesCount.description: Count of minutes. ≥ '0' for the first step and > '1' for subsequent steps

template.subject: Introduction Email
template.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I wanted to reach out regarding...

emailAccounts.description: Email accounts used to send emails for this sequence

scheduleId.description: Schedule Id. Default user schedule is used if omitted

isArchived.description: Indicates if the sequence is archived

emailsCountPerDay.description: Maximum number of emails sent daily

daysToFinishProspect.description: Days taken for a prospect to finish

emailSendingDelaySeconds.description: Delay between sending emails in seconds

dailyThrottling.description: Number of prospects processed within 24-hour period

disableOpensTracking.description: Whether to disable email open tracking

template.subject: Quick question about {{companyName}}
template.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I noticed you're leading initiatives at {{companyName}} and wanted to reach out regarding our solution that could help with your sales automation needs.

Would you be open to a quick chat this week?

Best regards,
John

subType.content: Hi {{firstName}}, I noticed your great work at {{companyName}}. Would love to connect and discuss potential synergies between our companies.

example.name: Sales Follow-up
example.subject: Re: Our previous conversation
example.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to follow up on our previous conversation about...

id.description: Unique identifier for the email template

html.description: HTML version of the email body

text.description: Plain text version of the email body

body.description: Email body content in both HTML and text formats

description.description: Description of what the variable is used for

variables.description: List of variables used in the template

body.html:
Hi {{firstName}},

Thank you for attending the demo today. I wanted to follow up on...
body.text:
Hi {{firstName}},

Thank you for attending the demo today. I wanted to follow up on...

id.description: Unique identifier for the branded link

domain.description: Domain name for the branded link

status.description: Current status of the domain verification

type.description: Type of DNS record for verification

host.description: Host record that needs to be added to DNS

value.description: Value that needs to be set in the DNS record

verificationRecord.description: DNS record information required for domain verification

created.description: Date when the branded link was created

lastVerificationAttempt.description: Date of the last verification attempt

isDefault.description: Whether this is the default branded domain

x-enum-descriptions.1: New - Initial contact status when first added to the system
x-enum-descriptions.2: Engaging - Actively attempting to establish communication
x-enum-descriptions.3: Replied - Contact has responded to communication
x-enum-descriptions.5: Not interested - Contact has explicitly declined further engagement
x-enum-descriptions.6: Unresponsive - Contact has not responded to multiple attempts
x-enum-descriptions.7: Do not contact - Contact should not be contacted further
x-enum-descriptions.8: Bad contact info - Contact information is incorrect or invalid
